tasks.task: Identifying strawberry variety performance in Alabama
subtasks: Observing plant size differences between Camarosa, Camino Real, and Ruby June
Noting stolon number and its management implications
Evaluating yield and total fruit number
Assessing fruit quality and soluble solids content
Analyzing potential alternatives to Camarosa (Camino Real and Ruby June)
Recommending early plant ordering from reliable suppliers
Advising on timely soil testing and bed preparation for optimal yields

tasks.task: Sharing insights on strawberry production in Alabama
subtasks: Discussing the significance of strawberry production growth in Alabama
Highlighting the role of environmental adaptation in variety selection
Summarizing a five-year strawberry variety trial results
Comparing plant characteristics (size, stolon production) and yields of various varieties
Evaluating fruit quality (e.g., soluble solids, flavor) and its factors

tasks.task: Addressing management strategies for strawberry cultivation
subtasks: Monitoring and controlling stolon growth to prevent disease
Managing plant density for better pesticide coverage and fruit visibility
Selecting appropriate varieties based on locality and environmental factors
Inoculum management to prevent disease spread among remaining fruit
